questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) accompanying each batch include evidence of approval for frozen processes, if required by the customer?
questions.guidance: Note: The traveler (KBK) does not need to reference the order or contract number but must ensure traceability to it or to the technical requirements.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include relevant order number or traceability to technical requirements?
questions.guidance: Note: The traveler (KBK) does not need to reference the PO or contract number but must ensure traceability to it or to the technical requirements.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include part identification, quantity, material and material grade?
Does the traveler (KBK) include receiving inspection?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies to transfer of work between facilities or departments.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include pre-process cleaning method(s)?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if this step is not required for the process.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include covers/masking?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if this step is not required for the process.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include fixtures, racks?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if fixtures and racks are not required, e.g., for local etching.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include in-process cleaning, water break test?
Does the traveler (KBK) include etching steps?
Does the traveler (KBK) include post-process steps including cleaning, drying, demasking and removal of fixtures and racks?
Does the traveler (KBK) include etching inspection step?
Does the traveler (KBK) include final inspection?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies to transfer of work between facilities or departments.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include packaging?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if parts are moved within the same facility.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include shipping?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if parts are moved within the same facility.

questions.question: Does the traveler (KBK) include documentation of rework that is traceable to the traveler (KBK) and all processing steps performed on the parts?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if no rework was observed during the audit.

questions.question: Are there separate acceptance steps for receiving inspection, processing, inspection, final inspection and shipping, as applicable?
questions.guidance: Note: Receiving inspection, final inspection and shipping do not apply if parts are moved within the same facility.

questions.question: Are in-process cleaning time, etching time and etching solution temperature recorded and traceable to the traveler (KBK)?
Do records show that maintenance was performed according to a procedure and with defined frequency?
questions.guidance: Note: This includes electrical contacts, periodic cleaning of rinse tanks, filter changes based on pressure drop, fin cooler filters, ripple calibration checks, etc.

questions.question: Does the compressed air supply for blast treatment and part blow-off include particle, moisture and oil filters with planned maintenance and air purity testing at the point of use?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if no blast treatment is used and compressed air is not used for drying parts.

questions.question: Are timers available, suitable for the purpose, calibrated and visible or audible from the tanks?
questions.guidance: Note: Timers used for process control must be calibrated.

questions.question: Are tanks marked with identification number, content and temperature ranges?
Are tank markings consistent with procedures, traveler (KBK) and records?
Are tanks and work surfaces free of corrosion and chemical spills that are detrimental to the process?
Are spray and immersion rinse tanks clean, clear, free-flowing or monitored for contamination level?
questions.guidance: Note: Does not apply to drain tanks if sufficient rinsing follows.

questions.question: Are spray and immersion rinse tanks arranged in a sequence that prevents cross-contamination of process tanks?
Do spray and immersion rinse tanks ensure sufficient neutralization and/or removal of process chemicals?
questions.guidance: Note: Special attention must be paid to parts such as small diameter tubes.

questions.question: Are tanks or parts moved?
questions.guidance: Note: Movement can be continuous or before use.

questions.question: Are tanks with defined temperature ranges operating within the specified range?

Is there a procedurally defined control system to ensure that the solution composition is maintained within control limits according to applicable specifications and a system to adjust analysis frequency based on the rate of change?
questions.guidance: Note: Impurities identified in the specification are considered composition requirements.

questions.question: Do the solution control records contain the following information for each monitored tank?
Tank identification?
Tank content?
Tank size (working volume) and fill level?
questions.guidance: Note: The working volume must be defined in the record, the fill level can be marked on the tank or automatically controlled.

questions.question: Analysis frequency?
Components to be analyzed?
Are operating tolerances based on specification requirements?
Are additions and adjustments recorded?
Are solution changes recorded?
Are the results of the analysis recorded?
Are the date and signature of the person performing the analysis recorded?
Are solution control records available for the past 12 months?
Are solution control records traceable to the traveler (KBK) and parts?
Are solution control records reviewed and approved by a responsible person?
Is the pH meter standardized daily, before first use, with at least two buffer solutions representing both the acidic and alkaline range, if applicable?
questions.guidance: Note: The pH buffers used to standardize the measuring device must represent the acidic and/or alkaline ranges, but do not need to cover the entire pH range of the tested samples.

questions.question: Are certified, commercial or better buffer solutions within shelf life?
Is the pH electrode stored in the appropriate storage solution when not in use?
Are solution control records reviewed for trends?
Are solution control records reviewed for out-of-tolerance conditions?
Are solution control records reviewed for corrective actions?
Are solution control records reviewed for revalidation of the process after corrective actions?
Are solution control records reviewed for revalidation of the process after solution changes?
Is the pH meter calibrated at least annually?
Is the temperature compensation function of the pH meter verified?
Are parts moved between tanks without undue delay so that process quality is not impaired?
If the auditee has cathodic cleaning capacity, is its use for cleaning parts for Nital etching prohibited?
Are parts tested for water break after cleaning and before etching for at least 15 seconds?
Are all surfaces to be etched free of oxide and scale?
Does the solution composition meet specification requirements?
Is the white light meter calibrated at least annually?
Does the calibration cover the usage range?
Is the light meter accurate to ±5% of the standard instrument reading?
Are 200 foot-candles/2200 lux white light or more available at the part surface for visual verification of indications?
Is the white light intensity testing performed at least weekly or before use and after equipment maintenance?
Has the facility properly demonstrated and recorded this testing?
Are procedures for evaluation techniques available?
questions.guidance: Note: Ensure that all procedures or work instructions for evaluation techniques meet all customer requirements and are available.

questions.question: Are photos or other visual standards for acceptance/rejection criteria available, if required by the customer or internal procedures?
questions.guidance: Note: Ensure that the images or other visual aids are suitable for the customer and meet all customer requirements.

questions.question: Must etching personnel for visual testing (VT) be qualified according to ISO 9712 or ASNT-TC-1A?

Annual vision test that meets one of the following: - Tumbling E according to ISO 18490 - 20/25 (Snellen) at 16 inches (40.64 cm), +/- 1 inch (2.54 cm)* - Jaeger No. 1 at not less than 12 inches (30.48 cm)* *With at least one eye, natural or corrected?
questions.guidance: Note: ISO 18490 tests (Tumbling E) must be performed according to the requirements contained therein.

questions.question: Annual vision examination showing the inspector can distinguish and differentiate between levels of contrast of the etch parts?
Were the vision and contrast exams administered by trained personnel designated by the Responsible Level 3, or a medically qualified individual?
Does a procedure define the re-examination requirements, including a wait of 30 days from failure date, for personnel not meeting / failing qualification criteria?
questions.guidance: Note: Re-examination is required after additional documented training in the area/s found to be deficient, 25% new questions on the new exam.

questions.question: Do the auditee's training/certification records contain the qualification date?
Do the auditee's training/certification records contain evidence of initial training?
Do the auditee's training/certification records contain evidence of on-the-job training?
Do the auditee's training/certification records for Level 1 and Level 2 personnel contain evidence of annual vision and contrast tests?
Do the auditee's training/certification records for Level 1 and Level 2 personnel contain evidence of initial written examination and initial and five-year practical examinations, including results?
Correct release/removal of certification based on results?
Part description
Identify whether it is an in-process job inspection or a historical job inspection:
Part number
Customer
Prime contractor
Order number/revision level
Part quantity
Serial/lot number
Date of order/order number
Processing specification and revision level
Is receiving inspection correctly performed according to traveler (KBK)?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if parts are transferred between departments and receiving inspection is not required.

questions.question: Is a defect standard performed with a frequency according to applicable specification?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if a daily defect standard is not required.

questions.question: Is pre-process cleaning performed according to traveler (KBK)?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if this step is not required.

questions.question: Is masking performed according to traveler (KBK)?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if this step is not required.

questions.question: Is the part positioned and fixed according to traveler (KBK)?
Is in-process cleaning, e.g., alkaline cleaning, performed according to traveler (KBK)?
Is a 15-second water break-free surface observed after the cleaning cycle?
Are the etching steps performed according to traveler (KBK)?
Are parts positioned during etching to minimize/prevent air entrapment or evolving gases in pockets or other recessed areas?
Are parts promptly and thoroughly rinsed after etching to prevent local over-etching?
questions.guidance: Note: Local over-etching may be visible as streaks running across the part surfaces.

questions.question: Are post-main-process steps (e.g., removal of dirt) performed according to traveler (KBK)?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if this step is not required.

questions.question: Are post-process demasking and cleaning performed according to traveler (KBK)?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if this step is not required.

questions.question: Is post-processing forced drying performed and is the temperature at least 50°F (28°C)?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if this step is not required.

questions.question: Are in-process cleaning time, Nital etching time and Nital etching solution temperature recorded on the traveler (KBK) or in a record with traceability to the traveler (KBK)?
Are process parameters compliant with internal instructions and specification?
questions.guidance: Note: For Nital/Temper etching, the etching time may be based on the time to correctly etch a known defect standard or to achieve a specific gray scale.

questions.question: Are all required surfaces etched?
Are all required surfaces inspected?
Is inspection performed under the correct light intensity?
Are all indications identified?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if there are no indications.

questions.question: Are all indications correctly evaluated?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if there are no indications.

questions.question: Are all inspection results properly recorded and traceable to the parts?
Were the parts processed by a certified Level 1, Level 2 or Level 3 person?
Were indications identified by a certified Level 1, Level 2 or Level 3 person?
Was acceptance/rejection of the part performed by a certified Level 2 or Level 3 person or a Level 1 person with specific written criteria from a Level 2 or Level 3 person?
Are all operations signed and dated by the operator/inspector?
Was the solution composition controlled according to requirements?
questions.guidance: Note: See specification for solution control requirements, some solutions may be controlled by composition, some by time required for a test piece to reach a specific gray scale level.

questions.question: Are all process control and process monitoring/recording devices calibrated?
Are all rework operations documented?
questions.guidance: Note: N/A applies if no rework is required for this job.
